body: I'm not sure what you mean by "Currently guru will abort if any package ... has some I/O, parser or type error."  Guru has always set the `AllowErrors` flag for type-based queries such as `describe`, `definition`, and `implements`.  For queries that need pointer analysis (`callers`, `callees`, `pointsto`, and others), there is no point setting this flag since SSA construction and pointer analysis require a well-formed program.
